ITEMINFO_1579:
Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. Adding this
honey to Max Soup makes the taste very smooth. It also
has the same effect as a Max Revive.
ITEMINFO_1580:
Mushrooms that have the power of changing Dynamax
forms. They boost all stats of a Pokémon during battle.
ITEMINFO_1581:
A twig from a species of tree called Galarica that grows
in certain areas around the Galar region. It’s a material
for an accessory for a certain Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_1582:
A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.
Giving it to a Galarian Slowpoke makes the Pokémon
very happy.
ITEMINFO_1583:
Having one of these cards increases the selection
available to you in boutiques and hair salons.
ITEMINFO_1584:
A pass to go to the Isle of Armor. Show it to the rail
staff at Wedgehurst Station.
ITEMINFO_1585:
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water
using Rotom’s power. It’s a sparkling white that
shines brilliantly.
ITEMINFO_1586:
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water
using Rotom’s power. It’s a glistening black that
shines reddish-black.
ITEMINFO_1587:
Having one of these charms increases the Exp. Points
your Pokémon get. A machine-like object is inside it.
ITEMINFO_1588:
Rare ore that can be obtained on the Isle of Armor.
Something good will happen if you give it to a collector
on the Isle of Armor.
ITEMINFO_1589:
Having one of these mysterious and unique charms
makes it more likely you’ll encounter a Pokémon with
a mark.
ITEMINFO_1590:
Reins that people presented to the king. They enhance
Calyrex’s power over bountiful harvests and unite
Calyrex with its beloved steed.
ITEMINFO_1591:
Reins that people presented to the king. They enable
those who are connected to communicate with each
other. The reins separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.
ITEMINFO_1592:
A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.
Placing it on the head of a Galarian Slowpoke makes
the Pokémon very happy.
ITEMINFO_1593:
A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It’s written
by Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.
ITEMINFO_1594:
A clue about the legend of giants. It’s written
by Peony and has unique drawings.
ITEMINFO_1595:
A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It’s written
by Peony and has a unique drawing.
ITEMINFO_1596:
A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped.
There’s a photo attached to it showing a shining hole
opening above the Max Lair.
ITEMINFO_1597:
A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail
staff at Wedgehurst Station.
ITEMINFO_1598:
A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to
be chipped. Maybe it’s meant to be part of something.
ITEMINFO_1599:
A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests
gave you. It radiates faint light.
ITEMINFO_1600:
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful
Harvests’ beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong
and very flexible.
ITEMINFO_1601:
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful
Harvests’ beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very
smooth to the touch.
ITEMINFO_1602:
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved
steed likes to eat. It grew in a field covered in snow.
ITEMINFO_1603:
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved
steed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.
ITEMINFO_1604:
Mysterious ore that can be obtained in the Max Lair.
Something good will happen if you give it to a
collector in the Crown Tundra.
ITEMINFO_1605:
Seeds to plant in a field. The kind of carrot you’ll get is
determined by which field you plant the seeds in.
ITEMINFO_1606:
A patch that can be used to change the regular Ability
of a Pokémon to a rarer Ability.
ITEMINFO_1607:
Cords that shine when you hold them up to the light.
The people of old times presented these to the King of
Bountiful Harvests to express their gratitude.
ITEMINFO_1608:
A mysterious balm that somehow has the power to calm
Dialga in its frenzy.
ITEMINFO_1609:
A mysterious balm that somehow has the power to calm
Palkia in its frenzy.
ITEMINFO_1610: A mysterious balm to be used when battling Arceus.
ITEMINFO_1611:
A string exuding a mysterious energy that makes you
feel a strange sense of connection. It’s loved by
certain Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_1612:
A baked treat made from Berries and other ingredients,
which is often eaten in regions such as Galar. It is
beloved by a surprising number of Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_1613:
A fruit whose shell can be used to form the capsules of
all manner of Poké Balls when crafting them from
scratch. Its proper name is actually “Brown Apricorn.”
ITEMINFO_1614:
A hidden gem gaining popularity in Jubilife Village and
beloved by Pokémon. This sweet treat can be fed to
a Pokémon to cure any status condition it may have.
ITEMINFO_1615:
An item that sharply boosts the offensive and defensive
stats of a Pokémon in battle. These effects disappear
if the Pokémon leaves the battle.
ITEMINFO_1616:
An item that sharply boosts the critical-hit ratio of
a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the
Pokémon leaves the battle.
ITEMINFO_1617:
A dumpling that will make a Pokémon become fixated on
a move in battle. The Pokémon will deal more damage
when using that move but will take more damage as well.
ITEMINFO_1618:
These pickled vegetables prime a Pokémon for battle.
The Pokémon takes a hard-hitting stance, which boosts
the damage dealt by its moves by 50 percent.
ITEMINFO_1619:
When eaten, this curious snack temporarily swaps a
Pokémon’s offensive stats with its defensive stats.
ITEMINFO_1620:
A fern used for crafting items made to be thrown.
When these curled leaves are unfurled, they can serve
as nature’s wrapping paper.
ITEMINFO_1621:
A rare seed that can be given to the captain of the
Security Corps to have a Pokémon master a move
so it can be used in the agile style or strong style.
ITEMINFO_1624:
A type of ice beloved by the Lord of the Tundra,
Avalugg. This ice is said to be fragments of ancient
Avalugg that lived long ago.
ITEMINFO_1625:
Proof that you have completed the trial set by Uxie,
the Being of Knowledge that lives in Lake Acuity.
This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.
ITEMINFO_1626:
Proof that you have completed the trial set by Azelf,
the Being of Willpower that lives in Lake Valor.
This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.
ITEMINFO_1627:
Proof that you have completed the trial set by Mesprit,
the Being of Emotion that lives in Lake Verity.
This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.
ITEMINFO_1628:
When combined with an Apricorn, this mysterious
tumbled stone can draw out the properties required
to forge a Poké Ball.
ITEMINFO_1629:
A flute that can be used to call special Pokémon that
are willing to bear you around the region. Its timbre is
eerie and mysterious.
ITEMINFO_1630:
An herbal medicine that can restore 60 HP to a
Pokémon, just as a Potion does. Yet the bitter taste
will make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.
ITEMINFO_1631:
An herbal medicine that can restore 100 HP to a
Pokémon, just as a Super Potion does. Yet the bitter taste
will make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.
ITEMINFO_1632:
Honey that sparkles with an amber hue. It is beloved
by bug Pokémon and Pokémon with fairylike charms,
so they will gather wherever a comb of it is thrown.
ITEMINFO_1633:
Beautiful stalks of rice bursting with life. Pokémon that
dwell and wander among the fields love these grains and
will gather wherever the stalks are thrown.
ITEMINFO_1634:
Large, juicy beans that grow in pods. These beans are
beloved by fish Pokémon, as well as bird Pokémon and
their flying ilk, so throw one and they will gather around.
ITEMINFO_1635:
A large and well-ripened mushroom. It is beloved by the
more monstrous Pokémon, as well as dragon Pokémon,
so they will gather wherever one is thrown.
ITEMINFO_1636:
Translucent crystals that are beloved by Pokémon
bearing a resemblance to grass, plants, or minerals.
They will gather wherever a lump of this salt is thrown.
ITEMINFO_1637:
A handy log of wood that can be used for anything,
from crafting common goods needed for daily living
to producing works of art.
ITEMINFO_1638:
The king of herbs, glittering and brilliant. Combining
this herb with other materials needed to make medicines
will boost their efficacy.
ITEMINFO_1639:
A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.
It can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lady of
the Ridge, Lilligant.
ITEMINFO_1640:
A recipe for crafting Poké Balls from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Apricorn and 1 Tumblestone.
ITEMINFO_1641:
A recipe for crafting Great Balls from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Apricorn, 1 Iron Chunk, and
1 Tumblestone.
ITEMINFO_1642:
A recipe for crafting Ultra Balls from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Apricorn, 2 Iron Chunks, and
2 Tumblestones.
ITEMINFO_1643:
A recipe for crafting Feather Balls from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Apricorn and 1 Sky Tumblestone.
ITEMINFO_1644:
A recipe for crafting Pokéshi Dolls from scratch.
Required materials: 3 logs of Wood.
ITEMINFO_1646:
A recipe for crafting Smoke Bombs from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Caster Fern leaf and
1 Sootfoot Root.
ITEMINFO_1647:
A recipe for crafting Scatter Bangs from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Pop Pod and 1 Caster Fern leaf.
ITEMINFO_1648:
A recipe for crafting Sticky Globs from scratch.
Required materials: 1 Spoiled Apricorn, 1 Ball of Mud,
and 1 Caster Fern leaf.
ITEMINFO_1649:
A recipe for crafting Star Pieces from scratch.
Required materials: 3 Red Shards, 3 Blue Shards,

An item to be held by a Pokémon. This clear, sparkling
amulet protects the holder from having its stats lowered
by moves used against it or by other Pokémon’s Abilities.
ITEMINFO_1883:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This herb will allow
the holder to mirror an opponent’s stat increases to
boost its own stats—but only once.
ITEMINFO_1884:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This protective glove
boosts the power of the holder’s punching moves and
prevents direct contact with targets.
ITEMINFO_1885:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This hooded cloak
conceals the holder, tricking the eyes of its enemies
and protecting it from the additional effects of moves.
ITEMINFO_1886:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This loaded dice
always rolls a good number, and holding one can ensure
that the holder’s multistrike moves hit more times.
ITEMINFO_1888:
A long loaf sliced into top and bottom halves. Its aroma
of wheat and its straightforward, salty flavor make it pair
well with all kinds of sandwich ingredients.
ITEMINFO_1889:
A condiment that packs a very tart punch yet pairs well
with various ingredients.
ITEMINFO_1890:
A condiment with very salty and tart flavor. While a
number of other ingredients go into its signature flavor,
the noble tomato is its heart and soul.
ITEMINFO_1891:
A very spicy condiment that’s indispensable when bread
is on the table. It pairs tremendously with ketchup.
ITEMINFO_1892:
A condiment that unites salty and sweet and also packs a
richness that makes bread a delight to eat. The finest
butter products are made of 100 percent Moomoo Milk.
ITEMINFO_1893:
A very sweet condiment. People in Paldea seem to favor
the sweet varieties over the unsweetened.
ITEMINFO_1894:
A condiment with a very spicy kick. It’s thanks to
Scovillain that this sauce gets its signature mouth-
tingling burn.
ITEMINFO_1895:
A very salty seasoning, unsurprisingly. People quite
like the grains of salt that can be gathered from the
footprints of particularly jagged Naclstack.
ITEMINFO_1896:
A seasoning packing very spicy flavor. It goes nicely
with oilier foods and works especially well when you
add just a pinch for a hint of flavor.
ITEMINFO_1897:
A condiment that’s very sweet and very sour. It goes
especially well with fruit and is easy to incorporate into
a sandwich.
ITEMINFO_1898:
A very sweet condiment. Folks in Paldea seem to love
the varieties that really let the sweetness sing.
ITEMINFO_1899:
A condiment offering very sweet and very tart flavor.
It goes well with more ingredients than you’d expect,
making it a convenient go-to.
ITEMINFO_1900:
A condiment that’s very sweet and likewise very sour.
Take care when adding it to sandwiches, as the sweet
side can overwhelm.
ITEMINFO_1901:
A condiment with sour and bitter notes. It’s surprisingly
useful, as it makes a nice counterpoint to oilier foods.
ITEMINFO_1902:
A condiment offering faint notes of sour and bitter
flavors. The most prized varieties are the ones Smoliv
love the smell of—such oils’ quality is assured.
ITEMINFO_1903:
A very sour condiment. Vinegars derived from grapes are
popular in Paldea. Highly effective when used to add
just a light note of flavor.
ITEMINFO_1904:
A legendary condiment told of only in books. Word has
it that one taste of its sweet flavor stimulates the
digestive system and cures a lack of appetite.
ITEMINFO_1905:
One of the condiments spoken of as legends. Its mellow
saltiness is said to be tremendously effective when it
comes to promoting health.
ITEMINFO_1906:
This surpassingly sour condiment is said to be super
effective in helping the eater recover from exhaustion.
Only a scant few people know it exists.
ITEMINFO_1907:
A legendary condiment with a deeply bitter taste. It’s
said to dramatically bolster a body’s immune defenses,
though that hasn’t been proven.
ITEMINFO_1908:
The legendary condiment said to have the mightiest of
all spicy flavors. It’s said that a single bite will kick the
metabolism into high gear immediately.
ITEMINFO_1909:
This bitter-tasting ingredient is simple and
straightforward—just add it to all kinds of other
ingredients for a delightfully crunchy time.
ITEMINFO_1910:
This very tart ingredient has a lot of savory elements
to it, making it popular with many Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_1911:
A very tart ingredient. Some varieties are also very
sweet, and these are prized above all others by the
people of Paldea.
ITEMINFO_1912:
A tart and bitter ingredient. Using it together with rich-
tasting ingredients in a sandwich will really make the
most of a cucumber’s fresh-veggie aroma.
ITEMINFO_1913:
This very sour ingredient is made by pickling veggies
in a flavorful brine made from spices and vinegar.
ITEMINFO_1914:
This spicy veggie is indispensable to many sandwiches.
It goes well with rich ingredients.
ITEMINFO_1915:
An ingredient with some sweetness to it. Its spiciness and
fragrance are milder than those of other onions, making
it a pleasant bite.
ITEMINFO_1916:
An ingredient with some bitterness. When sliced, it adds
a nice accent to a sandwich.
ITEMINFO_1917:
An ingredient with some bitterness—but its bitter notes
and overall flavor are pleasantly mild compared to its
green cousin.
ITEMINFO_1918:
An ingredient with some bitterness. It’s not much
different from its red counterpart in flavor, but mixing
the colors makes a feast for the eyes.
ITEMINFO_1919:
An ingredient with sweet notes—though its flavor is
very mild. The avocado’s richness, however, makes it
satisfying to eat.
ITEMINFO_1920:
This very salty ingredient has been cooked just shy of
charred, making it burst with fragrance and tasty flavor.
ITEMINFO_1921:
A very salty ingredient—and that very saltiness is what
makes it such a nice companion to veggies.
ITEMINFO_1922:
This ingredient is very salty like regular ham, but the
difference is prosciutto is not cooked after it is cured,
giving it a fun freshness.
ITEMINFO_1923:
A very salty and spicy ingredient. This type of sausage
has particularly robust salty flavor, and the spicier
varieties are extra popular.
ITEMINFO_1924:
A very salty and bitter ingredient. The balance between
the potent saltiness and the herbs’ bitterness make this
sausage a pleasure.
ITEMINFO_1925:
This very salty ingredient is the thing to add if you want
to make your sandwich truly filling.
ITEMINFO_1926:
A very sweet and salty ingredient. It’s a nutritious
processed food made with a concentrate derived from
shed Klawf shells.
ITEMINFO_1927:
A very salty and bitter ingredient with that unmistakable
smoky flavor. It pairs exceptionally well with veggies.
ITEMINFO_1928:
When used in a sandwich, this very salty and bitter
ingredient is at its best paired with sour seasonings.
ITEMINFO_1929:
An ingredient with a touch of saltiness. It’s full of
nutrients and can be enjoyed with all sorts of seasonings.
ITEMINFO_1930:
A very salty ingredient and a popular dish in Paldea.
It’s undeniably filling.
ITEMINFO_1931:
An ingredient with a touch of sweetness. It’s unclear how
well this raw block of tofu will serve as a sandwich filling.
ITEMINFO_1932:
An ingredient with a touch of sweetness. It’s unclear how
well this cooked rice will serve as a sandwich filling.
ITEMINFO_1933:
A nice salty ingredient. It’s unclear how well these boiled
noodles will serve as a sandwich filling.
ITEMINFO_1934:
This very tart ingredient—a soft salad that’s all about
potatoes—pairs tremendously well with bread.
ITEMINFO_1935:
A very salty ingredient. This thinly sliced cheese is
perfect for adding to a sandwich.
ITEMINFO_1936:
A very sweet ingredient. This go-to fruit is sweet and
rich, and it’s beloved by many Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_1937:
A very tart and sweet ingredient, popular for its ability
to make a sandwich visually striking.
ITEMINFO_1938:
This very sweet ingredient is sliced thin to make it easy
to add into a sandwich.
ITEMINFO_1939:
A very tart ingredient that has a light touch of sweetness
as well. It goes well with rich ingredients.
ITEMINFO_1940:
This very tart ingredient is a fruit of southern lands,
and its color and texture are a thrill. It’s been cut into
chunks to be easily manageable.
ITEMINFO_1941:
A very spicy ingredient—so spicy as to leave no room
for ambivalence about it. You either like it or you don’t.
ITEMINFO_1942:
A very spicy condiment. Its distinctive sharp sizzle in
your sinuses makes it a good match for rich fillings.
ITEMINFO_1943:
A very spicy condiment. Just watch out—use too much
of this potent seasoning, and it’ll cancel out the other
flavors.
ITEMINFO_1944:
This very spicy condiment seems close to horseradish at
first, but you’ll find that it has a superb flavor all its own.
ITEMINFO_1945:
A very bitter ingredient that stands out among veggies
for its quirky flavor. People tend to either like it or not
like it—they rarely sit on the fence.
ITEMINFO_1946:
A very bitter ingredient that’s quite versatile, as herbs
go. It’s fragrant and goes well with tomatoes.

A roomy basket packed with all sorts of things for use
when enjoying picnicking with your Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_2313:
A bottle emblazoned with the academy’s emblem.
It’s light, sturdy, and vacuum insulated, so it’ll keep
your hots hot and your colds cold.
ITEMINFO_2314:
A bottle emblazoned with the academy’s emblem.
It’s light, sturdy, and vacuum insulated, so it’ll keep
your hots hot and your colds cold.
ITEMINFO_2315:
A polka-dot-patterned bottle that’s small, light, and
even comes with a cup. The detachable strap makes it
handy for walking around with.
ITEMINFO_2316:
A striped bottle that’s small, light, and even comes with
a cup. The detachable strap makes it handy for walking

The academy’s standard-issue cup for picnicking. The
careful design of its mouth makes it popular both inside
and outside the academy.

The academy’s standard-issue cup for picnicking. The

ITEMINFO_2324:
The academy’s standard-issue tablecloth. It’s made with
the latest fiber-processing technology and is so tough

ITEMINFO_2326:
A botanically themed tablecloth featuring Grass-type
